column1: The Grey Wood was a wood growing between Mount Mindolluin in Gondor and the beacon-hill of Amon Dîn to the north. It formed an easterly outlier of the larger Drúadan Forest
column2: where the remnant of the Drúedain dwelt in the Third Age. Its trees masked the eastern entrance to the ancient and forgotten Stonewain Valley through the White Mountains.

column1: During the War of the Ring
column2: the Drúedain shared their knowledge of the secret Valley with the Rohirrim
column3: and so Théoden and his Men passed through the Grey Wood to the relief of Minas Tirith. After the War
column4: Aragorn returned to the Grey Wood
column5: and it was here that he granted Ghân-buri-Ghân and his people the freedom of the whole Drúadan Forest.
